meanings.definition: Surrounding or enclosing on all sides.
meanings.sent1: The inclosing walls made the garden feel cozy.
meanings.sent2: The house had an inclosing fence around the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The inclosing trees seemed to give the forest a big hug.
meanings.sent4: The fog was like an inclosing blanket over the city.
meanings.sent5: The inclosing darkness of the cave made it hard to see.

meanings.definition: To insert or include something within something else.
meanings.sent1: She was inclosing a note inside the gift box.
meanings.sent2: Please inclose your payment with the order form.
meanings.sent3: The magician inclosed the rabbit in the hat.
meanings.sent4: He inclosed his love letter in an envelope.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map was inclosed in a bottle for safekeeping.

meanings.definition: To enclose with a barrier or fence.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was inclosing the pasture with a new fence.
meanings.sent2: They decided to inclose the garden to keep out rabbits.
meanings.sent3: The children inclosed themselves in a blanket fort.
meanings.sent4: The castle walls inclosed the kingdom from invaders.
meanings.sent5: The zoo inclosed the lions in a secure enclosure.
